title: Ḵudziteeyi Át Ḵulagaawú / The Battle of the Giants
author: Seidayaa / Elizabeth Nyman

sentences.sentence_tlingit: tle chʼa yáakʼudé áwé chʼu tle ḵuwdudlihaa.
sentences.sentence_english: suddenly they got into a fight.

lines.line_tlingit: tle chʼa yáakʼudé áwé chʼu tle ḵuwdudlihaa.
lines.line_english: suddenly they got into a fight.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlél tsu wáa sá utéeyin yú.á yá shaaxʼw, chʼu tle daat yáx̱ sá dag̱aatee.
sentences.sentence_english: These mountains used to be fine; they were nice and neat.

lines.line_tlingit: Tlél tsu wáa sá utéeyin yú.á yá shaaxʼw,
lines.line_english: These mountains used to be fine;

lines.line_tlingit: chʼu tle daat yáx̱ sá dag̱aatee.
lines.line_english: they were nice and neat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áyú has ḵulagaawu áwé yóo, ách áwé yóo dag̱aatee a x̱oo aa áwé yóo, yóo, wé shaa.
sentences.sentence_english: But when [those giants] fought [they rolled over them], so some of them are [squashed in places] like that, and like that, those mountains.

lines.line_english: But when [those giants] fought [they rolled over them],

lines.line_tlingit: ách áwé yóo dag̱aatee a x̱oo aa áwé yóo,
lines.line_english: so some of them are [squashed in places] like that,
and like that,
those mountains.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé, “X̱át ax̱ aayíx̱ nax̱satee yá Tʼaaḵú,” yóo áwé wooch has daayadaḵá.
sentences.sentence_english: Then “The Taku should belong to me,” each said to the other.

lines.line_english: Then
“The Taku should belong to me,”
each said to the other.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Tléikʼ, de yan x̱á x̱waanuk, tlél aadé aax̱ g̱unayéi ḵwaanoogu yé,” tle yéi yaawaḵaa.
sentences.sentence_english: “No, I’m already sitting here; I’m not about to move off,” [Lkoodaséitsʼk] said.

lines.line_english: “No, I’m already sitting here;

lines.line_tlingit: tlél aadé aax̱ g̱unayéi ḵwaanoogu yé,”
lines.line_english: I’m not about to move off,”
[Lkoodaséitsʼk] said.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle wé kaax̱ shagax̱dulʼixʼ aa yoo x̱ʼatánk áwé.
sentences.sentence_english: It was the one who was to be decapitated who was speaking.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle wé kaax̱ shagax̱dulʼixʼ aa yoo x̱ʼatánk áwé.
lines.line_english: It was the one who was to be decapitated who was speaking.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A shukát ḵu.a chʼa wooch has x̱ʼadaxéett x̱á, chʼu tle kát has seixʼaaḵwch tle, tle tsu yáaxʼ áwé chʼu tle a daa kei has x̱ʼeil.aatch, wooch has x̱ʼadaxéett.
sentences.sentence_english: First they would provoke each other, then they would forget about it, and then they would start up on it again, provoking each other.

lines.line_tlingit: A shukát ḵu.a chʼa wooch has x̱ʼadaxéett x̱á,
lines.line_english: First they would provoke each other,

lines.line_tlingit: chʼu tle kát has seixʼaaḵwch tle,
lines.line_english: then they would forget about it,

lines.line_tlingit: tle tsu yáaxʼ áwé chʼu tle a daa kei has x̱ʼeil.aatch,
lines.line_english: and then they would start up on it again,
provoking each other.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: De wáa nanée sáwé chʼu tle wóosht has at jishoowanéi.
sentences.sentence_english: One day they got into a fight [over it].

lines.line_tlingit: De wáa nanée sáwé chʼu tle wóosht has at jishoowanéi.
lines.line_english: One day they got into a fight [over it].

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle aawasháat, wé Wasʼasʼéich áwé woosháat yú.á.
sentences.sentence_english: He grabbed him; Wasʼasʼéi grabbed [Lkoodaséitsʼk], they say.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle aawasháat, wé Wasʼasʼéich áwé woosháat yú.á.
lines.line_english: He grabbed him; Wasʼasʼéi grabbed [Lkoodaséitsʼk], they say.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle ḵúnáx̱ tle ya a shaayi tle yáaxʼ tle aax̱ aawalʼéexʼ, kaax̱ aseiwalʼéexʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: Then he broke his head off right here; he decapitated him.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle ḵúnáx̱ tle ya a shaayi tle yáaxʼ tle aax̱ aawalʼéexʼ,
lines.line_english: Then he broke his head off right here;
he decapitated him.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yú diyáade áwé kei aawag̱íxʼ, “Lkoodaséitsʼk shaayíx̱ / nax̱satee.” Áwé chʼu tle yóo yatee, aasxʼi sáani áa yoo kawsi.áa.
sentences.sentence_english: He threw it across [the river, saying], “Let it become Lkoodaséitsʼk’s head.” So that is how it is. There are little trees growing here and there on it.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle yú diyáade áwé kei aawag̱íxʼ,
lines.line_english: He threw it across [the river, saying],
“Let it become Lkoodaséitsʼk’s head.”
So that is how it is.
There are little trees growing here and there on it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle a téix̱ʼi áwé tle aax̱ kei aawax̱útʼ, wé Tʼaaḵú ash jikáx̱ akawulḵeedích áwé.
sentences.sentence_english: Tuen he yanked his heart out, because [Lkoodaséitsʼk] had tried to wrest [the Taku] from him.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle a téix̱ʼi áwé tle aax̱ kei aawax̱útʼ,
lines.line_english: Tuen he yanked his heart out,

lines.line_tlingit: wé Tʼaaḵú ash jikáx̱ akawulḵeedích áwé.
lines.line_english: because [Lkoodaséitsʼk] had tried to wrest [the Taku] from him.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá du téix̱ʼ, “Lkoodaséitsʼk téix̱ʼi ḵu.a Tʼaaḵú Téix̱ʼix̱ nax̱satee.” áwé tle wéi yéi naadaa tle yéi, tle yáat uwaxíx.
sentences.sentence_english: As for his heart, [he said,] “Let Lkoodaséitsʼk’s heart become the Heart of the Taku.” [The Taku] flows like this; it landed here.

lines.line_english: As for his heart, [he said,]
“Let Lkoodaséitsʼk’s heart become the Heart of the Taku.”

lines.line_tlingit: áwé tle wéi yéi naadaa tle yéi,
lines.line_english: [The Taku] flows like this;
it landed here.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yú ḵaa téix̱ʼi yáx̱ kayaxát.
sentences.sentence_english: It looks like a human heart.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle yú ḵaa téix̱ʼi yáx̱ kayaxát.
lines.line_english: It looks like a human heart.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá a leikachóox̱ʼu ḵu.a awé tlax̱ yóo yínde aawayísh áwé tsá anax̱ kei aawayísh.
sentences.sentence_english: The windpipe he pulled down and then yanked it out.

lines.line_tlingit: Yá a leikachóox̱ʼu ḵu.a awé tlax̱ yóo
lines.line_english: The windpipe
he pulled down
and then yanked it out.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yáat yáx̱ kayaxát wéit.
sentences.sentence_english: It [became a small island that] extends as far as over there.

lines.line_english: It [became a small island that] extends as far as over there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa daat yís sáwé yáat aas áa wsi.aa yáat, ha tle yá ḵaa x̱ikshá yáx̱ tle yóo.
sentences.sentence_english: For some reason there are trees growing here, [it is] like a human shoulder, like this.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼa daat yís sáwé yáat aas áa wsi.aa yáat,
lines.line_english: For some reason there are trees growing here,

lines.line_tlingit: ha tle yá ḵaa x̱ikshá yáx̱ tle yóo.
lines.line_english: [it is] like a human shoulder, like this.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yáat áwé wé a leikachóox̱ʼunáx̱ kei aawax̱útʼ, tle yáat, tle áx̱ naadaa tle yóo.
sentences.sentence_english: Here he pulled the windpipe out, here, and water flows out there.

lines.line_tlingit: Yáat áwé wé a leikachóox̱ʼunáx̱ kei aawax̱útʼ,
lines.line_english: Here he pulled the windpipe out,
here,
and water flows out there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Ya Tʼaaḵú kaadé ng̱adaa yá tʼéexʼ kahéeni, chʼa ldakát ḵaa x̱ʼeis, Lingít x̱ʼeis,” yú.á.
sentences.sentence_english: “Let ice water flow out into the Taku for everyone, for the Tlingit,” they say [he said].

lines.line_tlingit: “Ya Tʼaaḵú kaadé ng̱adaa yá tʼéexʼ kahéeni,
lines.line_english: “Let ice water flow out into the Taku
for everyone,
for the Tlingit,” they say [he said].

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé wáa sá i tóoch tsu gúxʼaa / tlél katulalʼúxʼx̱ aadé si.áatʼi yé wé héen.
sentences.sentence_english: So what do you think: we don’t drink even a cup of it, it is so cold, that water.

lines.line_english: So

lines.line_tlingit: wáa sá i tóoch tsu gúxʼaa / tlél katulalʼúxʼx̱ aadé si.áatʼi yé
lines.line_english: what do you think: we don’t drink even a cup of it, it is so cold,
that water.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé yeedát áwé a káx̱ has x̱ʼax̱awóosʼ – wé Cháankʼi Éesh yéi sh kalneek tle a kanax̱ yei uwagút wé xʼáatʼkʼátskʼu x̱á, tle kʼadéin a daa yoo akwdlig̱ínk yóo akanéek.
sentences.sentence_english: Now I have been asking them about it- Harry Carlick says he has walked across that small island and inspected [the waterfall] carefully, he says.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé yeedát áwé a káx̱ has x̱ʼax̱awóosʼ –
lines.line_english: Now I have been asking them about it-

lines.line_tlingit: wé Cháankʼi Éesh yéi sh kalneek
lines.line_english: Harry Carlick says

lines.line_tlingit: tle a kanax̱ yei uwagút wé xʼáatʼkʼátskʼu x̱á,
lines.line_english: he has walked across that small island

lines.line_tlingit: tle kʼadéin a daa yoo akwdlig̱ínk yóo akanéek.
lines.line_english: and inspected [the waterfall] carefully, he says.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼu tle té áwé yéi yatee, chʼu tle solid rock áwé yéi yatee yóo akanéek.
sentences.sentence_english: It is nothing but rock; it is solid rock, he says.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼu tle té áwé yéi yatee,
lines.line_english: It is nothing but rock;

lines.line_tlingit: chʼu tle solid rock áwé yéi yatee yóo akanéek.
lines.line_english: it is solid rock, he says.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼu tle yu diyíndáx̱ áwé yéi kwsikaak wé té.
sentences.sentence_english: [It starts] from somewhere far below and is very thick, that rock.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼu tle yu diyíndáx̱ áwé yéi kwsikaak
lines.line_english: [It starts] from somewhere far below and is very thick,
that rock.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Well, it could be, you know, wé du [leikachóox̱ʼu]. Wé g̱éelʼ x̱áawé yéi yatee wé Lkoodaséitsʼk, shaa, shaa áwé / yéi yatee.
sentences.sentence_english: Well, it could be, you know, his [windpipe]. [After all,] Lkoodaséitsʼk is a [rock] cliff, a mountain; it is a mountain.

lines.line_tlingit: Well, it could be, you know, wé du [leikachóox̱ʼu].
lines.line_english: Well, it could be, you know, his [windpipe].

lines.line_tlingit: Wé g̱éelʼ x̱áawé yéi yatee wé Lkoodaséitsʼk,
lines.line_english: [After all,] Lkoodaséitsʼk is a [rock] cliff,
a mountain;
it is a mountain.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé – [Wé Wasʼasʼéi áktsú?] Wé Wasʼasʼéi ḵu.a áwé tle du tóon at wootee.
sentences.sentence_english: So … {Wasʼasʼéi too?} Wasʼasʼéi was upset [by what happened],

lines.line_english: So …
{Wasʼasʼéi too?}
Wasʼasʼéi
was upset [by what happened],

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Hú ḵu.a, “Keishixjixʼaa keekaadé yéi kḵwasgéet.” Á áwé ách áwu á.
sentences.sentence_english: He [said], “I will locate across from Keishixjixʼaa.” Therefore he is there.

lines.line_english: He [said],
“I will locate across from Keishixjixʼaa.”
Therefore he is there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Tlax̱ wáa yan toowajag̱u aa lingít sáwé ax̱ yaax̱ sh tóo gakg̱waltseen,” tle yéi yaawaḵaa / hú ḵu.a.
sentences.sentence_english: “People that are truly self-confident will gain sustenance from my sides,” he said.

lines.line_tlingit: “Tlax̱ wáa yan toowajag̱u aa lingít sáwé
lines.line_english: “People that are truly self-confident
will gain sustenance from my sides,”
he said.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé wé - anax̱ yan wutuwaḵúx̱. Áwé ax̱ x̱án aa yéeyi tlél… Óh - chʼu g̱unáa yateeyi yéidáx̱ du jidé at gug̱waxéex.
sentences.sentence_english: One time we went ashore there. Now my deceased husband was not [daunted by anything]; no matter what kind of place [he had to go to get it, he would keep on until] he got what he was after.

lines.line_english: One time
we went ashore there.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé ax̱ x̱án aa yéeyi tlél…
lines.line_english: Now my deceased husband was not [daunted by anything];
no matter what kind of place [he had to go to get it,
he would keep on until] he got what he was after.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yéi áwé a yáx̱ kei wdlitlétʼ wé shaa, tle yéi x̱áawé yatee.
sentences.sentence_english: He climbed up that mountainside; it was [steep] like this.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle yéi áwé a yáx̱ kei wdlitlétʼ wé shaa,
lines.line_english: He climbed up that mountainside;
it was [steep] like this.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle yéi kínde kei yaawatsáḵ. Yáat áwé chʼu tle yóo daak uwanugu yé yáax̱ yatee.
sentences.sentence_english: He followed [the hillside] upward. Here there is an outcropping;

lines.line_english: He followed [the hillside] upward.

lines.line_tlingit: Yáat áwé chʼu tle yóo daak uwanugu yé yáax̱ yatee.
lines.line_english: Here there is an outcropping;

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé yáat áwé áx̱ kei uwagút tle yóo, tle yóo, tle wé daak uwanugu yé yáx̱ yateeyi yé.
sentences.sentence_english: he came up to this place, like this, to the outcropping.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé yáat áwé áx̱ kei uwagút tle yóo,
lines.line_english: he came up to this place,
like this,

lines.line_tlingit: tle wé daak uwanugu yé yáx̱ yateeyi yé.
lines.line_english: to the outcropping.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle aadé yaa gagóot áwé tsá yú.á tle wé yínde áwé ḵux̱ awdlig̱ín, tle wé yaakw tlél duteen.
sentences.sentence_english: When he had made his way there, he said, he looked back down, and the boat was not visible.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle aadé yaa gagóot áwé tsá yú.á tle
lines.line_english: When he had made his way there, he said,

lines.line_tlingit: wé yínde áwé ḵux̱ awdlig̱ín, tle wé yaakw tlél duteen.
lines.line_english: he looked back down, and the boat was not visible.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Ha wáa sáyá déis ḵúx̱de kḵwadagóot?” Á áwé chʼa yá áx̱ kei nagut yé áwé wé kéitladi kʼwátʼi tle yóo áx̱ nali.átk, tle wé a kúdi.
sentences.sentence_english: “Now how am going to get back?” Now where he was climbing there were seagull eggs lying here and there, [seagull] nests.

lines.line_english: “Now how am going to get back?”

lines.line_tlingit: Á áwé chʼa yá áx̱ kei nagut yé áwé wé kéitladi kʼwátʼi tle yóo
lines.line_english: Now where he was climbing there were seagull eggs

lines.line_tlingit: áx̱ nali.átk, tle wé a kúdi.
lines.line_english: lying here and there, [seagull] nests.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A kaax̱ áawé yéi awsinee / wé kéitladi kʼwátʼi.
sentences.sentence_english: He was gathering the seagull eggs from [the nests].

lines.line_tlingit: A kaax̱ áawé yéi awsinee / wé kéitladi kʼwátʼi.
lines.line_english: He was gathering the seagull eggs from [the nests].

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle tlél du tóoch wuḵéesh wé – wé yóo daak uwanugu yé yáx̱ yateeyi yéit / wugoodí.
sentences.sentence_english: It looked to him like it would be too risky [to go out onto] that outcropping [and] walk about on it.

lines.line_tlingit: Tle tlél du tóoch wuḵéesh wé –
lines.line_english: It looked to him like it would be too risky

lines.line_tlingit: wé yóo daak uwanugu yé yáx̱ yateeyi yéit / wugoodí.
lines.line_english: [to go out onto] that outcropping [and] walk about on it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: How he gonna come back? – he could make it all right.
sentences.sentence_english: How was he going to come back? – he could make it all right [but he could see no way back].

lines.line_english: How was he going to come back? –

lines.line_tlingit: he could make it all right.
lines.line_english: he could make it all right [but he could see no way back].

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A ách áwé aax̱ ḵux̱ wudigút.
sentences.sentence_english: So he turned back there.

lines.line_english: So
he turned back there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Du kʼoodásʼi tóo kwshéiwé yéi aya.óo wé… séit akoostán wé / wé kéitladi kʼwátʼi.
sentences.sentence_english: I guess he had [the sleeves of] his shirt [knotted together and inside them] he had those seagull eggs slung around his neck.

lines.line_tlingit: Du kʼoodásʼi tóo kwshéiwé yéi aya.óo wé…
lines.line_english: I guess he had [the sleeves of] his shirt [knotted together and inside them]

lines.line_tlingit: séit akoostán wé / wé kéitladi kʼwátʼi.
lines.line_english: he had those seagull eggs slung around his neck.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Dikée áyú, naalée yú dikée.
sentences.sentence_english: Up high, he was way up high.

lines.line_english: Up high, he was way up high.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Oon yoo x̱ʼadudli.áatk, “Líl xʼwán ḵáaḵwx̱ x̱at wuneeḵ léelkʼw,” yéi daayaduḵá.
sentences.sentence_english: They used to speak to [the mountain], “Don’t let anything bad happen to me, grandfather,” they would say to it.

lines.line_english: They used to speak to [the mountain],

lines.line_tlingit: “Líl xʼwán ḵáaḵwx̱ x̱at wuneeḵ léelkʼw,” yéi
lines.line_english: “Don’t let anything bad happen to me, grandfather,” they
would say to it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Á áwé ḵaa x̱ʼaya.áx̱ch wé át, wé shaa tsú.
sentences.sentence_english: And that mountain could understand human speech too.

lines.line_english: And

lines.line_tlingit: ḵaa x̱ʼaya.áx̱ch wé át, wé shaa tsú.
lines.line_english: that mountain could understand human speech too.
